description: Number of primitive Pythagorean triangles with side n.
comments: Consider primitive Pythagorean triangles (A^2 + B^2 = C^2, (A, B) = 1, A <= B); sequence gives number of times AUBUC takes value n.
links: Ron Knott, Pythagorean Triples and Online Calculators
formula: a(n)=0 for n=1 and n=2 (mod 4)=A016825. a(n)=A024361(n)+A024362(n). - _Lekraj Beedassy_, Dec 01 2003
author: _David W. Wilson_
